org.mitre.provenance.workflowengine

Class RelationalLineageCapture

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mitre.provenance.workflowengine.LineageTracer
      • org.mitre.provenance.workflowengine.RelationalLineageCapture

  • public class RelationalLineageCapture
extends LineageTracer
    This object implements the lineage tracer API and is used for capturing information about workflows that are being executed. The captured information is stored in an PLUS-specific schema within a relational database.
    Author:
    DMALLEN

    • Method Detail

      • getCollection

        public ProvenanceCollection getCollection()
        Get a provenance collection that contains all objects captured by this tracer so far.
        Returns:
        a ProvenanceCollection

      • setWriteImmediate

        public void setWriteImmediate(boolean writeImmediate)
        Controls whether objects are immediately written to the database as soon as they are observed. Set to true if you want to write things as they're found; set to false if you intend to pull the entire provenance collection out at a later time.
        Parameters:
        writeImmediate -

      • startWorkflow

        public void startWorkflow(Workflow wf,
                          Activity startingPoint)
        Description copied from class: LineageTracer
        This method will be called when a workflow starts execution. This should be the first method called, prior to any activity or transition being triggered. If your LineageTracer needs to do some work at startup, this is the place to do it.
        Overrides:
        startWorkflow in class LineageTracer
        Parameters:
        wf - the workflow that is beginning
        startingPoint - the first Activity reached, which may be a START_STATE
        See Also:
        LineageTracer.startWorkflow(Workflow, Activity)

      • endWorkflow

        public void endWorkflow(Workflow wf,
                        Activity endingPoint)
        Description copied from class: LineageTracer
        This method will be called when a workflow finishes execution. After this method is called, you can expect that no other activities or transitions will be triggered. If your LineageTracer needs to do some cleanup, this is the place to do it.
        Overrides:
        endWorkflow in class LineageTracer
        Parameters:
        wf - the workflow that is ending.
        endingPoint - the final Activity reached, which may be an END_STATE
        See Also:
        LineageTracer.endWorkflow(Workflow, Activity)

      • startActivity

        public void startActivity(Activity current,
                          Hashtable<String,PLUSObject> parameters)
        Description copied from class: LineageTracer
        This method will be called when an activity's execution is about to start.
        Overrides:
        startActivity in class LineageTracer
        Parameters:
        current - The activity that is about to be executed
        parameters - the parameters being passed to that activity.
        See Also:
        LineageTracer.startActivity(Activity, Hashtable)

      • transition

        public void transition(Transition t)
        Description copied from class: LineageTracer
        This method will be called when a transition is followed - after an activity has finished executing, before the next one starts. Warning: because of dependencies and backtracking, following a transition from A -> B does not guarantee that startActivity for B is the next signal to be called.
        Overrides:
        transition in class LineageTracer
        Parameters:
        t - the transiton being followed.
        See Also:
        LineageTracer.transition(Transition)

      • finishActivity

        public void finishActivity(Activity current,
                           Hashtable<String,PLUSObject> results)
        Description copied from class: LineageTracer
        This method will be called after an activity has finished executing.
        Overrides:
        finishActivity in class LineageTracer
        Parameters:
        current - the activity that just completed
        results - the results that it produced.
        See Also:
        LineageTracer.finishActivity(Activity, Hashtable)
